title: Wrongfully banned for 3rd party programs???
body:
Hey guys,

So about 14 months ago I stopped playing League of Legends due to traveling and not being able to maintain interest in it, 2 days ago I reinstalled LoL and tried to sign it and it says my account is permanently suspended. Confused, I made a ticket asking what the reason for the ban was and was advised I had used Bots (3rd party programs). Knowing that this is completely false I requested it was further investigated only for them to say that no mistake was made.. The issue I have is I know a mistake was made, as I have never downloaded Bots for any of my games, including League of Legends, so there was  no possible way a background program could even have triggered a false positive on their detection system. 

I digged around the forums and found a whole bunch of threads where people had the same issue from the same wave of bans and blamed Curse Client, while I did have this downloaded, I never really used it and you would think 9 months later they could easily tell if Curse was to blame for this ban considering it was the cause of so many others back then, so I don't think it was that. 

Basically, I just need some advice on how else to proceed. I normally wouldn't care and just play on one of the other accounts but I know an error has been made and I can't just let them take my account and provide an excuse I know is false. Just too stubborn when I know I'm right I think. Especially when the Riot staff who viewed the threads I mentioned earlier reply with 
> "poking further, however, it looks like this took place on under some rogue access on the account from another state. We've forced reset the password on your account as a precaution, but you should be able to log in again once you complete it as the suspension has been lifted as a one-time exception. Apologies for missing this the first time."
which just makes me think that maybe I'm just one of the people they missed on the first time of investigating it.. 

Thanks for any help. {{summoner:31}}

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Mew2,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=0a6M2xWE,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-12-30T03:37:18.202+0000)
>
> Thanks for any help. {{summoner:31}}

Riot never over turns ban like this. You have to show that you weren't. Get over it and make a new account this time dont use hacks.

and you wont look like you are HACKS4DAYS :P

Seems a bit stupid, bit disappointed that Riot in almost 2018 is still at it with the same old shit I seen 5 years ago, how much money a game need to make before their support system is actually effective... How would I show them I weren't? I requested they watched my games to prove everything was player controlled but I just got "Oh seems you have no other concerns, I'm closing the ticket now" as a response. Like, what? I get it would be annoying to watch games but not as annoying as losing your account and the excuse they give you being complete bs.

They do actually overturn these bans assuming they are either false, or there is evidence of compromise for the period in which the programs were used. Basically unless it was a sibling or friend who you shared account info or a pc or something with, you can probably get your account back.

That said, the time does complicate things. Assuming you didn't have anything illicit, then presumably the account was compromised. I would recommend first changing the password for the account, then respond to the ticket and mention you believe compromise may have been involved and ask for account ownership verification.
